destinations.name: Benjamin Franklin Statue & College Hall
destinations.description: The iconic statue of Benjamin Franklin, one of the Founding Fathers and founder of UPenn, stands in front of College Hall, the oldest building on campus. This Victorian Gothic building represents the heart of the campus and the educational legacy Franklin established.
destinations.location: College Hall, University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA 19104

route_plan.directions: Head east on Sansom St toward S 36th St, turn right onto S 36th St, take the stairs and follow campus pathways to reach the statue in front of College Hall

destinations.name: Fisher Fine Arts Library
destinations.description: A stunning Victorian Gothic building designed by renowned architect Frank Furness. Even non-art majors will appreciate its historical grandeur, massive reading room, and intricate staircases that provide excellent photo opportunities.

route_plan.directions: Head north from the statue area, take the stairs toward S 34th St, then turn right onto S 34th St. The library will be on your right.

destinations.name: ENIAC Exhibit (School of Engineering)
destinations.description: Visit the birthplace of the modern computer! The Penn School of Engineering displays original ENIAC panels commemorating the world's first general-purpose electronic computer, built here during WWII. This 30-ton 'giant brain' revolutionized computing and represents Penn's pivotal role in technological history.

route_plan.directions: Head north on S 34th St, cross the road, then turn left onto Smith Walk. The School of Engineering building will be on your left.

destinations.name: Penn Museum
destinations.description: The Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology houses over one million artifacts from major civilizations worldwide. Highlights include a monumental Egyptian Sphinx (one of the largest outside Egypt), ancient Roman mosaics, Chinese bas-reliefs, and Mesopotamian treasures. The building itself is architectural art, blending Italian Renaissance and Victorian Gothic styles.

route_plan.directions: Head southeast from the engineering building, turn right onto S 33rd St, then turn left onto South St. Turn right into the museum entrance area, and the museum will be on your left.
